titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. L. R. Cheek, Verdict
CWG4212

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Livingston Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Against
L R Cheek.

The Grand Jury of Livingston County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse L R Cheek of the offense of selling Spiritous Liquor to a Slave named Henry the property of D B Sanders committed as follows. viz: The said L R Cheek on the 9th day of February 1863 in the County aforesaid did sell or give Spritous Liquor to a Slave named Henry the property of D B Sanders and without the written order or consent of him the said D B Sanders or of the person entitled to the custody or control of the said Slave for the time being and he the said L R Cheek not having then the custody or control of the said Slave Henry against the Statute in such cases made and provided and against the peace and diginity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Jno. Barret
Commonwealths Atty
14th Judicial District

Endorsed
"A True Bill."
"A Birdwell. foreman Grand Jury."
"We the Jury find the Defendant guilty "as charged in the Indictment and assess. the fine at Fifty "Dollars."

R.. L.. Heelkold
A Copy attest
James W. Cade
C L C C

Livingston Cir Ct
L. R. Cheek

Sept 12th 1863
Remit all except costs & attys fees
T E Bramlette

Sept 12th 1863
Remit all except costs & attys fees
T E Bramlette
